src/include/scwrapper.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*! \file scwrapper.h
00002  *  This file contains C wrapper functions for system calls.
00003  *  The wrappers are used by user programs to perform system
00004  *  calls from C.
00005  */
00006 
00007 #ifndef _SCWRAPPER_H_
00008 #define _SCWRAPPER_H_
00009 
00010 /* Include the constants that identifies system calls. */
00011 
00012 #include "sysdefines.h"
00013 
00014 /*! Wrapper for the system call that returns the version of the kernel. */
00015 static inline unsigned long
00016 version(void)
00017 {
00018  unsigned long return_value;
00019  __asm volatile("syscall" : 
00020                  "=a" (return_value) :
00021                  "a" (SYSCALL_VERSION) : 
00022                  "cc", "%rcx", "%r11");
00023  return return_value;
00024 }
00025 
00026 /*! Wrapper for the system call that prints a string.
00027  * @param string Pointer to the string to be printed.
00028  * */
00029 static inline long
00030 prints(const char* const string)
00031 {
00032  long return_value;
00033  __asm volatile("syscall" : 
00034                  "=a" (return_value) :
00035                  "a" (SYSCALL_PRINTS), "D" (string) : 
00036                  "cc", "%rcx", "%r11");
00037  return return_value;
00038 }
00039 
00040 /*! Wrapper for the system call that prints a hexadecimal value.
00041  * @param value hexadecimal value to be printed.
00042  */
00043 static inline long
00044 printhex(const unsigned long value)
00045 {
00046  long return_value;
00047  __asm volatile("syscall" : 
00048                  "=a" (return_value) :
00049                  "a" (SYSCALL_PRINTHEX), "D" (value) : 
00050                  "cc", "%rcx", "%r11");
00051  return return_value;
00052 }

00066 /*! Wrapper for the system call that terminates threads and processes. */
00067 static inline void
00068 terminate(void)
00069 {
00070  __asm volatile("syscall" : 
00071                  :
00072                  "a" (SYSCALL_TERMINATE) : 
00073                  "cc", "%rcx", "%r11");
00074 }

00076 /*! Wrapper for the system call that creates processes.
00077  * @param executable integer identifying the program which should be loaded 
00078  * and run as a process.
00079  */
00080 static inline long
00081 createprocess(const int executable)
00082 {
00083  long return_value;
00084  __asm volatile("syscall" : 
00085                  "=a" (return_value) :
00086                  "a" (SYSCALL_CREATEPROCESS), "D" (executable) : 
00087                  "cc", "%r11", "%rcx");
00088  return return_value;
00089 }

00091 /*! Wrapper for the system call that pauses the process for a 
00092  *  specified number of ticks. 
00093  *  @param ticks integer holding the number of ticks the process should 
00094  *         be paused.
00095  */
00096 static inline long
00097 pause(const int ticks)
00098 {
00099  long return_value;
00100  __asm volatile("syscall" : 
00101                  "=a" (return_value) :
00102                  "a" (SYSCALL_PAUSE), "D" (ticks) : 
00103                  "cc", "%r11", "%rcx");
00104  return return_value;
00105 }

00111 time(void)

00121 /*! Wrapper for the system call that allocates a memory block
00122  *  @param length integer holding the number of bytes to allocate
00123  *  @param flags integer holding the type of memory block to allocate
00124  */
00125 static inline long
00126 alloc(unsigned long length, int flags)
00127 {
00128  long return_value;
00129  __asm volatile("syscall" : 
00130                  "=a" (return_value) :
00131                  "a" (SYSCALL_ALLOCATE), "D" (length), "S" (flags) : 
00132                  "cc", "%r11", "%rcx");
00133  return return_value;
00134 }

00150 /*! Wrapper for the system call that allocates a port. */
00151 static inline long
00152 allocateport(unsigned long id)
00153 {
00154  long return_value;
00155  __asm volatile("syscall" :
00156                  "=a" (return_value) :
00157                  "a" (SYSCALL_ALLOCATEPORT), "D" (id) :
00158                  "cc", "%r11", "%rcx", "memory");
00159  return return_value;

00162 /*! Wrapper for the system call that finds a port given an owning process and
00163     port identity. */
00164 static inline long
00165 findport(unsigned long id, unsigned long process)
00166 {
00167  long return_value;
00168  __asm volatile("syscall" :
00169                  "=a" (return_value) :
00170                  "a" (SYSCALL_FINDPORT), "D" (id), "S" (process):
00171                  "cc", "%r11", "%rcx", "memory");
00172  return return_value;
00173 }

00175 /*! Wrapper for the system call that sends a message to a port. */
00176 static inline long
00177 send(unsigned long port, const struct message* const message)
00178 {
00179  long return_value;
00180  __asm volatile("syscall" :
00181                  "=a" (return_value) :
00182                  "a" (SYSCALL_SEND), "D" (port), "S" (SYSCALL_MSG_SHORT),
00183                  "b" (message):
00184                  "cc", "%r11", "%rcx", "memory");
00185  return return_value;
00186 }
00187 
00188 /*! Wrapper for the system call that sends a notification to a port. */
00189 static inline long
00190 send_notification(unsigned long port)
00191 {
00192  long return_value;
00193  __asm volatile("syscall" :
00194                  "=a" (return_value) :
00195                  "a" (SYSCALL_SEND), "D" (port),
00196                  "S" (SYSCALL_MSG_NOTIFICATION):
00197                  "cc", "%r11", "%rcx", "memory");
00198  return return_value;
00199 }

00201 /*! Wrapper for the system call that sends a message of arbitrary length to 
00202     a port. */
00203 static inline long
00204 send_long(unsigned long               port, 
00205           const struct message* const message,
00206           const void* const           buffer, 
00207           const unsigned long         buffer_length)
00208 {
00209  long return_value;
00210  __asm volatile("movq %%rcx,%%r10;\
00211                  syscall;\
00212                  movq %%r10,%%rcx" :
00213                  "=a" (return_value) :
00214                  "a" (SYSCALL_SEND), "D" (port), "S" (SYSCALL_MSG_LONG),
00215                  "d" (buffer), "c" (buffer_length), "b" (message):
00216                  "cc", "%r11", "%r10", "memory");
00217  return return_value;
00218 }
00219 
00220 /*! Wrapper for the system call that receives a message from a port. */
00221 static inline long
00222 receive(unsigned long         port, 
00223         struct message* const message,
00224         unsigned long* const  sender, 
00225         unsigned long* const  message_type)
00226 {
00227  long return_value;
00228  __asm volatile("syscall" :
00229                  "=a" (return_value), "=D" (*sender), "=S" (*message_type) :
00230                  "a" (SYSCALL_RECEIVE), "D" (port), "S" (SYSCALL_MSG_SHORT),
00231                  "b" (message):
00232                  "cc", "%r11", "%rcx", "memory");
00233  return return_value;
00234 }
00235 
00236 /*! Wrapper for the system call that receives a message of arbitrary size 
00237     from a port. */
00238 static inline long
00239 receive_long (unsigned long         port, 
00240               void* const           buffer,
00241               unsigned long*        buffer_length, 
00242               struct message* const message,
00243               unsigned long* const  sender, 
00244               unsigned long* const  message_type)
00245 {
00246  long return_value;
00247  __asm volatile("movq %%rcx,%%r10;\
00248                  syscall;\
00249                  movq %%r10,%%rcx" :
00250                  "=a" (return_value), "=D" (*sender),
00251                  "=S" (*message_type), "=c" (*buffer_length) :
00252                  "a" (SYSCALL_RECEIVE), "D" (port), "S" (SYSCALL_MSG_LONG),
00253                  "b" (message), "d" (buffer), "c" (*buffer_length):
00254                  "cc", "%r11", "%r10", "memory");
00255  return return_value;
00256 }

00280  return return_value;

00370 /*! Wrapper for the system call that performs a wait operation on a condition
00371     variable. */
00372 static inline long
00373 conditionvariablewait(long condition_variable_handle,
00374                       long mutex_handle)
00375 {
00376  long return_value;
00377  __asm volatile("syscall" :
00378                  "=a" (return_value) :
00379                  "a" (SYSCALL_CONDITIONVARIABLEWAIT), 
00380                  "D" (condition_variable_handle),
00381                  "S" (mutex_handle) :
00382                  "cc", "%r11", "%rcx", "memory");
00383  return return_value;
00384 }
